title: Process Business Analyst
job_description: SummaryJob DescriptionThis role plays a crucial part in leading digital transformation within the organization by leveraging innovative solutions, optimizing processes, and delivering business value through exceptional user experiences and product quality. The primary function of this position is to transform the Purchasing group from paper-based processes to digitally managed. The goal of this position is to bring visibility, control, and efficiency while driving innovation.Essential Job Responsibilities And Duties Create and execute the process digitalization roadmap for ADVICS North America Purchasing Team.  Identify specific business opportunities and ways to capitalize on them.  Influence stakeholders to support business projects.  Lead project management for selected projects.  Assist in developing workflows by discussing, analyzing, and documenting processes.  Evaluate and implement changes and improvements to optimize efficiency and productivity.  Explore the integration of artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning algorithms to identify patterns and predictive insights for process optimization and automation.  Develop dashboards and reports to visualize process performance metrics and trends, enabling informed decision-making.  Present ongoing reports to stakeholders, acting as a liaison for communication and performance needs.  Facilitate testing criteria, test plans, and implementation with end users.  Collaborate with IT and developers to ensure optimal user experience and product quality.  Communicate with other teams and stakeholders to identify, monitor, and resolve issues. Other Responsibilities And Duties Business Value Creation: Develop strategies that align with organizational goals and add measurable value.  User Experience Optimization: Ensure digital products meet user expectations and deliver an exceptional experience.  Product Quality Assurance: Create testing scenarios, conduct user tests, and document support manuals for high-quality products.  Change Management: Drive and facilitate change within the organization to support digital transformation initiatives.  Data Analysis and Insights: Extract, analyze, and interpret data to inform decision-making and propose system enhancements.  Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work effectively with IT, developers, stakeholders, and other teams to achieve project objectives.  Self Directed: Proven ability to work autonomously. Work Environment and Physical DemandsThe work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The work is performed in a typical office setting. The work is mostly sedentary.  The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate. Open office environment exists.  This position requires extensive communication with others internally to the company and with external IT sources both verbal and written.  Required to work additional hours to meet deadlines, as necessary. Minimal travel is required to meeting sites. Equipment and Supporting Services Basic Equipment needed is PC/Laptop, Cell Phone, Business Cards and Security Badge. QualificationsEducation and Experience:Desired Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Management, Finance, Computer Science, Technology, Engineering, or Supply Chain Management.  2-5 years of experience as a Business Analyst, Process Owner, or Process Manager.  Experience in digital product or services development, particularly in the automotive industry and purchasing, is advantageous.  Familiarity with testing and quality assurance processes.  Proficiency in using tools such as Nintex K2, Microsoft Power BI -- SharePoint - Office and Oracle.  Knowledge of data extraction, validation, and analysis techniques.  Experience with electronic procurement and analytical software is preferred. Special Skills: Strong analytical abilities and problem-solving skills.  Excellent communication and presentation skills.  Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team environment.  Adaptability and flexibility to navigate change and evolving project requirements.  Detail-oriented with a focus on delivering high-quality results.  Leadership qualities to facilitate ideation sessions and drive change initiatives effectively.  Strategic thinking and ability to align digital strategies with organizational goals.  Sound knowledge of and ability to apply business and purchasing principals.  Prior experience in a team-based management culture. Company DescriptionAbout Us:ADVICS has a global network for the development, production, and sales of our products, with facilities in North America, Central America, Asia, and Europe. We can supply the very best systems for our customers' needs, anywhere in the world.As an integrated supplier, we develop all components of our brake systems, including the brake pads, and utilize all resources of the ADVICS group to provide the world's best brake systems. By exceeding customer expectations and providing local service, we strive to promote safety on all of the world's roads.About Us: ADVICS has a global network for the development, production, and sales of our products, with facilities in North America, Central America, Asia, and Europe. We can supply the very best systems for our customers' needs, anywhere in the world. As an integrated supplier, we develop all components of our brake systems, including the brake pads, and utilize all resources of the ADVICS group to provide the world's best brake systems. By exceeding customer expectations and providing local service, we strive to promote safety on all of the world's roads.

title: Business Analyst
job_description: ESSENTIAL JOB TASKS:Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.· User-Centric Collaboration: Work closely with business staff to gain a deep understanding of the information systems and technology needs.· Impact Assessment: Determine the implications of project changes on both the business and existing systems.· Process Mapping: Analyze existing business processes to identify areas for improvement. Develop and maintain process map and workflow including automation opportunities.· Recommendation: Provide informed recommendations for process and system changes and enhancements.· Planning and Communication: Negotiate project plans and timeframes, ensuring clear comprehension among stakeholders and business teams.· Specification Development: Create and communicate detailed implementation specifications to developers, documenting those using tools like Jira.· Testing and Verification: Satisfy project analysis, testing verification, and address user IT requests related to system modifications.· Client Satisfaction: Collaborate with Project Managers to ensure client requirements are met.· Documentation: Work with Project Managers to maintain accurate and up-to-date project documentation.· Problem Analysis: Research and analyze system defects or challenges, leveraging tools to understand their nature and impact.· Continuous Improvement: Stay up to date with industry trends and best practices. Proactively identify areas for continuous improvement in both the business and IT.QUALIFICATIONS AND EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS:· College Degree in Operations or Information Technology preferred· Minimum of 5 years of print experience KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:· Core Values: Exemplify the core values of the company, including Partnership, Integrity, Drive, and Initiative, fostering relationships, trust, and proactive engagement in continuous improvement.· Communication: Possess excellent communication skill and demonstrate strong leadership qualities. Be highly organized with impeccable personal organization and computer skills.· Industry Knowledge: Showcase deep experience and knowledge within the industry.· Technology Proficiency: Proficient in Microsoft Office 365, including Teams.· Problem Solving: Demonstrate strong creative and problem-solving skills.· Attention to Detail: Be extremely organized with great attention to detail.· Leadership: Exhibit excellent management skills with the ability to lead, facilitate, motivate, and organize.· Teamwork: Successfully collaborate with others in a team environment.

title: Manufacturing Business Analyst
job_description: Title: Manufacturing Business AnalystLocation: Fairfiled, OHDuration: Direct-HireWork Requirements: US Citizen, Green Card Holder, or Authorized to Work in the USQualified candidates should send their resume (Word format) to Nick Castiglia at NCastiglia@INSPYRsolutions.com.OverviewThis will serve as a lead role working with the company to improve, streamline, and analyze processes and data that support business information systems and provide solutions across multiple departments in a Manufacturing context. This role will develop technical solutions and create business value by defining, documenting and analyzing requirements and assisting with problem-solving and root-cause analysis through data analysis. You will work closely with Manufacturing users to develop solutions to improve business processes and utilization of ERP. This role also ensures that solutions are documented, tested, and accepted before being implemented into the production environment. Will build relationships with the users by communicating regularly with them regarding daily or ongoing issues. Manages user expectations by informing them of project status and changes to their working environment. The ideal candidate will have knowledge of NetSuite Advanced Manufacturing.Duties/ResponsibilitiesUnderstand and document business requirements; communicate and validate with relevant stakeholders; identify business process improvement opportunities.Gathers and analyzes data and process issues to evaluate and identify areas of improvement in the business and recommend automation improvements.Create and maintain saved searches, saved reports, and analytics per departmental requests.Assist the NetSuite Administrator with large implementations and development projects to add new modules and integrations.Collaborate with the NetSuite Administrator to develop, test, and deploy new system modules and functionality.Develop written training and procedural documentation to aid users in the proper use of the system.Identify the root cause of system errors by performing data discovery, analysis, and modeling before recommending and applying solutions.Champion adopting best practices, policies, project management, and change management.Required Skills/ AbilitiesKnowledge of Advanced Manufacturing, Bills of Materials, and Manufacturing Routings.Knowledge of Order to Case, Procure to Pay, and Record to Report processes.Some knowledge of basic accounting and business principles.Excellent communication skills and professionalism, and a desire to help at all times while maintaining an approachable business posture and exhibiting a positive attitude toward users.Ability to prioritize and complete complex projects in an accurate and timely manner.Evidence of excellent project management, organization, and time-management skills.Analytical skills to determine root causes and determine the best course of action for effective solutions.Ability to understand and develop "best practices” based on the company's mission and vision. Education & Experience Four-year college degree or equivalent combination of education, training, and experience3-5 years of experience with business analysis and developing business processes and solutions2+ of related work experience with NetSuiteItems considered a plus:RF Smart WMSNetSuite MRP About INSPYR Solutions:Technology is our focus and quality is our commitment. As a national expert in delivering flexible technology and talent solutions, we strategically align industry and technical expertise with our clients' business objectives and cultural needs. Our solutions are tailored to each client and include a wide variety of professional services, project, and talent solutions. title: Business Analyst (2 Positions)
job_description: Job Title: Business Analyst (2 Positions)Location: Remote with some travel to Columbus, OhioPeriod: Now to 07/31/2024 with possibility of extensionHours/Week: 40 hoursRate: Up to $112/hr depending upon experienceScope Of ServicesThe Business Analyst will focus on supporting functional design and build activities within the Construction domain, while the other Business Analyst will focus on the Customer domain. They will collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and analyze business requirements, develop detailed functional specifications, and facilitate stakeholder meetings and workshops. The Business Analysts will play a key role in translating business needs into technical requirements and supporting the testing and validation of domain-specific systems. Both resources must have experience with SAP.Role, Responsibilities, And DeliverablesCollaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and analyze business requirements related to construction projects (Construction Business Analyst) or customer-related initiatives (Customer Business Analyst). Develop detailed functional specifications, business process models, and workflow diagrams to support domain-specific initiatives. Facilitate stakeholder meetings, workshops, and interviews to elicit requirements and gather feedback on proposed solutions. Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams to translate domain-specific business needs into technical requirements and vice versa. Support the testing and validation of domain-specific systems, ensuring accuracy and compliance with business requirements. Provide ongoing support and guidance to end-users during the implementation and post-implementation phases of domain-specific projects. Utilize SAP experience to integrate SAP functionalities into the domain-specific projects and ensure alignment with SAP standards and practices. QualificationsBachelor's degree in Business Administration, Engineering, Construction Management, or a related field. Proven experience as a Business Analyst in the construction industry (for the Construction Business Analyst) or in customer-facing roles (for the Customer Business Analyst), with a strong understanding of domain-specific processes and best practices. Proficiency in business analysis techniques, including requirements elicitation, process modeling, and stakeholder management. Excellent analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data and make informed recommendations. Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with stakeholders at all levels of the organization. Experience working with SAP and familiarity with SAP modules relevant to the respective domain. Experience working in an agile environment and familiarity with agile methodologies is preferred. Knowledge of industry regulations and standards relevant to the respective domain is a plus.

title: Sr. Business Analyst
job_description: Business analysts identify, define and document business processes and software requirements to be developed as software or implementation of software. They serve as a liaison between business and IT teams by facilitating communication and determining software objectives that align with stated and unstated business needs. Key Responsibilities Obtain a deep understanding of relevant business area(s) to be able to recommend solutions and build high-quality requirements.Use a variety of techniques to understand business requirements, such as interviews, workshops, surveys, site visits, and storyboards.Shape business requirements by making recommendations and suggesting alternatives to proposed solutions.Understand technical options, limitations, costs, and risks. Communicate tradeoffs to business partners and work with them to shape requirements accordingly.Translate conceptual user requirements into clear, detailed functional requirements.Work with business and delivery teams to prioritize requirements.Help resolve competing priorities between stakeholder groups by facilitating stakeholder discussions and escalate issues where appropriate.Manage requirements scoping throughout the delivery process.Create artifacts as appropriate, including business case documentation, scope documentation, and process flows.Support delivery teams as they develop, test, and deploy solutions.Review delivery team output to ensure requirements are correctly interpreted; define and execute test cases.Document current processes and models to understand inefficiencies or gaps.Identify and assist in prioritizing opportunities to streamline business processes.Promote a collaborative team environment and provide mentorship to junior-level analysts.Skills and CompetenciesExperience determining the explicit and implicit needs and requirements of various stakeholders.Ability to quickly learn the objectives, structures, operations, and policies of a new business area.Strong problem resolution, negotiation, and influencing skills.Demonstrated ability to engage both developers and business partners to achieve target outcomes.Proven interpersonal skills and an ability to influence senior leaders and peers.Demonstrated ability to communicate complex technical information in a condensed manner to various stakeholders verbally and in writing.Experience creating documentation such as business case documentation or business requirements summaries.Adaptability and a willingness to learn new skills.Qualifications for Sr. Business AnalystBachelor’s degree (or equivalent years of experience).4-8 years of experience in business analysis.Background in construction or manufacturing or similar industries is preferred.Business analysis certification (e.g., CBAP) is preferred.EOE/M/F/Disabled/Veteran/DFSP

Resource management for the project work effort vs available team capacity.Collaborate closely with the wider technology teams to coordinate interdependencies and troubleshoot/resolve issues and understand overlaps of teams and applications helping to identify cross-dependencies & cross-impacts at earlier stages of discussion embracing dependency management process for maintaining timeliness of the project.Analyzes the needs & problems of a business & proposes solutions to improve its performance and efficiency.Business analysis feasibility assessment covering methodology, budget, & schedule, key stakeholders, elicitation techniques, and quality assurance methods.Translate business needs into system requirements and configurations.Ownership at program/project level by defining the functional expectations & confirming the feasibility of the proposed solutions.Supporting adherence to Audit & Controls timeliness.Coordinate, prioritize & track control activities with delivery teams.Open Audit Issues and Risks Issue documentation and tracking as needed.Writing clear and well-structured business requirements documents. title: Agile Business Analyst I-IV
job_description: Founded in 1934, Medical Mutual is the oldest and one of the largest health insurance companies based in Ohio. We provide peace of mind to more than 1.6 million Ohioans through our high-quality health, life, disability, dental, vision and indemnity plans. We offer fully insured and self-funded group coverage, including stop loss, as well as Medicare Advantage, Medicare Supplement, and individual plans.Medical Mutual’ s status as a mutual company means we are owned by our policyholders, not stockholders, so we don’t answer to Wall Street analysts or pay dividends to investors. Instead, we focus on developing products and services that allow us to better serve our customers and the communities around us and help our members achieve their best possible health and quality of life.Ideal Agile Business Analyst candidates will have the follow experiences: Manage the Product Backlog: Work with the Product Owners to create, refine, and prioritize work items in the backlog, including features and user stories with acceptance criteria.  Requirements Gathering: Collaborate with stakeholders to understand and document the business needs, processes, design (wireframes/mockups), and acceptance criteria.  Product Development Support: Work closely with developers to explain the product design, address their questions, and provide clarifications throughout the development process.  Testing and Quality Assurance: Collaborate with product owners and quality assurance resources to develop test plans and test cases to ensure that the developed product meets the specified requirements. Support functional and regression testing and troubleshoot issues, working with developers to rectify any defects.  Agile framework experience and/or knowledge (Scrum preferred): Strong understanding of Scrum processes. Perform story analysis to determine conditions of satisfaction and ensure acceptance criteria are clearly defined using Gherkin. Manage the evolution of user stories and other backlog items, including breaking down the stories, eliciting conversations, and facilitating story refinement and mapping sessions. Work with cross-functional team members to ensure user stories are concise, comprehensible, feasible, unambiguous, and verifiable. Can facilitate other scrum ceremonies as required. Business Systems Analyst IProvides the interface between the business and information technology areas. Works with business partners to identify business requirements and reviews/produces specifications for any change to technology applications. Works with the systems development team throughout the project life cycle to ensure that they provide systems solutions to meet business needs.Business Systems Analyst IIProvides the interface between the business and information technology areas with an understanding of priorities and high-level concerns of both areas. Works with business partners to analyze/prioritize business requirements and reviews/produces specifications for any change to technology applications. Works with the systems development team throughout the project life cycle to ensure that they provide systems solutions to meet business needs. Assists in the development of the business case and project estimates for the proposed solution.Business Systems Analyst IIIProvides the interface between the business and information technology areas to identify business requirements based on an understanding of priorities and high-level concerns of both areas. Works with the systems development team throughout the project life cycle to ensure that they provide systems solutions to meet business needs. Facilitates development of the business case and project estimates for the proposed solution. As required, functions as a project leader on small-scope projects.Business Systems Analyst IVProvides the interface between the business and information technology areas with an understanding of priorities and high-level concerns of both areas. Coordinates and leads the systems development team throughout the project life cycle (including post implementation) to ensure that they provide systems solutions to meet business needs. Develops the business case and project estimates for the proposed solution. Functions as a project leader on projects. Responsibilities Business Systems Analyst I Captures business needs and shapes requirements through dialogue with business partners.  Supports the development of documentation of solutions and verifies against user requirements.  Supports testing, implementation, and training phases of systems projects.  Participates in design reviews and walkthroughs to communicate systems designs and validate proposed solutions. Business Systems Analyst II Captures business needs and shapes requirements through dialogue with business partners and IT. Assists in the development of the business case and project estimates for the proposed solution.  Supports the development of documentation of solutions and verifies against user requirements.  Assists in conducting design reviews and walkthroughs to communicate systems designs and validate proposed solutions.  Leads the testing, implementation, and training phases of systems projects.  Provides project management support as needed.  Engages in continuous education and staff development.  Performs other duties as assigned. Business Systems Analyst III Captures business needs and shapes requirements through dialogue with business partners and IT. Leads the development of the business case and project estimates for the proposed solution.  Research alternative solutions, develops documentation of solutions and verifies against user requirements. Obtains approval on requirements.  Leads the testing, implementation, and training phases of systems projects.  Coordinates design reviews and walkthroughs to communicate systems designs and validate proposed solutions.  Provides project management leadership and coordination as needed. Business Systems Analyst IV Creation and maintenance of end-to-end automation of deployment, monitoring, and infrastructure management.  Build and configure delivery environments to support SDLC processes.  Creation and enforcement of governance around development quality and security processes.  Develop custom scripts to increase system efficiency and lower the human intervention time on any tasks.  Troubleshoot issues in preproduction environments and assist in successful elevation of development.  Document and recommend improvements and enhancements for our SDLC process.  Teach and train peers and developers on tooling and processes to help improve efficiency of their work.  Performs other duties as assigned. Qualifications  Business Systems Analyst I Education and Experience Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, business, or related field. Technical Skills And Knowledge: Basic understanding of system design concepts.  Familiarity with technical writing concepts.  Familiarity with systems development life cycle.  Business Systems Analyst II Education and Experience Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, business or related field.  2 year’s experience as a business analyst. Technical Skills And Knowledge: Advanced understanding of system design concepts.  Strong technical writing skills.  Advanced understanding of the systems development life cycle.  Business Systems Analyst III Education and Experience Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, business or related field.  5 year’s experience as a business analyst.  1 year of experience in project management. Technical Skills And Knowledge: Advanced understanding of system design concepts.  Advanced understanding of the systems development life cycle.  Working knowledge of project management practices.  Business Systems Analyst IV Education and Experience Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, business or related field.  6 year’s experience as a business analyst.  2 year’s experience in project management. Technical Skills And Knowledge: Advanced understanding of system design concepts.  Advanced understanding of the systems development life cycle.  Working knowledge of project management practices. deliver Excel spreadsheets, Word documents and PowerPoint presentations relative to projects assigned · Read and understand law, regulations and directives from states and USDOL · Lead discussion to title: Business Process Analyst
job_description: AtriCure, Inc. provides innovative technologies for the treatment of Afib and related conditions. Afib affects more than 33 million people worldwide. Electrophysiologists and cardiothoracic surgeons around the globe use AtriCure technologies for the treatment of Afib and reduction of Afib related complications. AtriCure’s Isolator® Synergy™ Ablation System is the first medical device to receive FDA approval for the treatment of persistent Afib. AtriCure’s AtriClip® Left Atrial Appendage Exclusion System products are the most widely sold LAA management devices worldwide. AtriCure’s Hybrid AF™ Therapy is a minimally invasive procedure that provides a lasting solution for long-standing persistent Afib patients. AtriCure’s cryoICE cryoSPHERE® probe is cleared for temporary ablation of peripheral nerves to block pain, providing pain relief in cardiac and thoracic procedures. For more information, visit AtriCure.com or follow us on Twitter @AtriCure.We foster a culture of inclusion by embracing diverse experiences and individuals where everyone’s authentic self is welcome. We offer supporting programs and resources that provide enriching and equitable opportunities for each person to contribute professionally and personally.Position SummaryThe Business Process Analyst (BPA) will consult and collaborate with business teams to capture business processes to ensure technical alignment. This role will partner with business stakeholders and SME’s, solution architects, data analysts, solution providers, and support personnel following the Agile framework and delivery. The BPA drives business collaboration and discussions on complex, strategic areas, building a process foundation that will scale. Develop concept/discovery to capture business requirements for delivery of solutions as well as streamline and enhance existing business processes and functions. This role will navigate and address business needs across the company through collaboration, prioritization, and problem solving.Essential Functions Of The Position Analyze existing processes, workflows, systems, and applications. Create as-is and to-be internal business processes and capture current business processes for future improvement and streamlining and as part of feature development. Identify key challenges and pain points within the processes.  Collaborate with the business to develop process mapping, conduct process engineering, capture opportunities for improvements/efficiencies, enhancements, optimization, automation, and/or new solutions. Ability to implement, manage, and support sales and financial solutions and related business processes.  Collect and analyze data in support of business request feasibility. Engage with business partner to analyze business processes, summarize findings and depth of business need. Translate request to technical team for feature and user story development. Articulate the voice of the customer and prioritize user stories that provide the most value to the business units and deliver with the smallest level of effort by the development team to support the agile methodology.  Participate in solutions design/development. Provide and share researched business needs and/or issues with examples, data, and artifacts. Provide baseline KPI to measure success of the proposed solution/enhancement, post release. Drive innovation to support business strategic plans.  Feature breakdown and story writing with acceptance criteria definition. Facilitate story grooming and develop tasks to support feature outline and objectives. Guide team through building test scripts for verification and validation and capture results. Communicate gaps in development as a result of testing outcome to ensure delivered solution and requirements align. Rectify results of bugs introduced in missed requirements.  Follow quality system validation process and develop and deliver required documentation. Collaborate on software records, validation plans, functional requirements, protocols and completion reports between business, developers and quality engineering.  Assist in project documentation creation and completion prior to initiative implementation (workflows, process maps, reports, turnover documentation, procedures) valuable for traceability, change management, and historical priorities and decisions. Placed and maintained in MS Teams for cross functional reviews and collaboration.  Drive alignment across processes, applications, systems, and solution development initiatives  Collaborates with other departments to improve quality of products and product development through project implementations and process improvements  Provides critical reporting and analysis of business process performance and make recommendations for enhancements, cost savings initiatives and improvements  Communicate with stakeholders Additional Essential Functions Of The Position Regular and predictable work performance  Ability to work under fast-paced conditions  Ability to make decisions and use good judgement  Ability to prioritize various duties and multitask as required  Ability to successfully work with others  Additional duties as assigned  Experience with DevOps and Continuous Delivery frameworks, Microsoft Azure and DevOps (or equivalent)  Familiarity with cloud-based Enterprise Application platforms used to support cross-functional business areas Basic Qualifications Bachelor’s degree required  Minimum three years of experience in a business process analyst role  Previous knowledge of sales solutions  Advanced understanding of business functions, workflows, and processes  Ability to interpret complex business processes and systems  Ability to analyze data and conduct process mapping  Ability to partner across all levels in the organization to initiate, develop and maintain effective working relationships  Understanding of the various application development lifecycles (e.g. Agile, Scrum)  Exceptional communication (written and verbal), facilitation and presentation skills  Ability to travel 10% Preferred Qualifications Excellent understanding of business complexity and project interdependencies  Three years of combined experience working in Agile environment with multiple teams and dependencies in an enterprise organization Other Requirements Ability to regularly walk, sit, or stand as required  Ability to occasionally bend and push/pull  Ability to occasionally lift up to 10 pounds  Ability to pass pre-employment drug screen and background check AtriCure has a variety of benefits available for US based employees and their families. Examples include Medical & Dental beginning day 1 of employment, 401K plus match, 20 days of paid Parental Leave, in addition to maternity leave, for new moms and dads, Volunteer Time off, Pet Insurance, and more. Corporate-based employees also have full access to our on-site fitness center and cafeteria. To see a complete list of our benefits, please visit our careers website: https://www.atricure.com/benefits AtriCure participates in the federal E-Verify program to confirm the identity of and employment authorization of all newly hired employees. For further information about the E-Verify program, please click here https://www.e-verify.gov/ AtriCure is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and provides Drug Free Workplaces. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national or ethnic origin, age, protected veteran status, status as an individual with disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law(s).Apply Now

title: Enterprise Resources Planning Business Analyst
job_description: Position SummaryThis ERP Business Analyst will conduct constant analysis of existing business process configuration within D365, and partner with production locations on improvements & changes. The focus for this role is on Continuous Improvement of D365 utilization across all HBD location. Since this role is the point of contact for all requests and changes to the production environment including technical errors and enhancement requests, the role requires understanding of all aspects of D365 from customer service to Manufacturing, through supply chain and to financial reconciliation. Key qualities for this position include strong communication skills, teamwork and partnership capabilities, business process knowledge & improvement methods, self-motivation and, critical thinking.Principle Duties and ResponsibilitiesPrimary point of contact for operations errors & troubleshooting technical issues raised by the plants. Work directly with our partner of record to resolve major production issues that occur.Champion new functional capabilities and participate in defining the D365 roadmap. Research and develop new functionality that is released by Microsoft and present it to the ERP Steering Committee.Vet and perform analysis on requests covering change improvements, system configuration improvement, process re-routing, etc.Interface with ERP Core Team and D365 partner of record to coordinate change, vet change across all other production plants, test & ensure no unintended impact for changes applied to D365.Partner with plant Continuous Improvement teams on suggesting and implementing process improvements.Lead & perform training to existing users as new functionality is introduced.Perform regular check points with all plants to receive input on status and confirm appropriate process is being followed.Perform all system validation during Microsoft programed upgrades. Job TitleBusiness Operations AnalystDepartmentStrategic Enrollment | Strategic Enrollment AdministrationThe Business Operations Analyst for the Office of Strategic Enrollment Management provides cross-functional business support for leaders and strategic initiatives within the Office of Strategic Enrollment Management. This position is located in the Office of the Vice Provost, SEM and will fulfill a broad range of duties, including oversight of complex projects.Monitors resources and activity across the division, including but not limited to finance, processes and operations, human capital, facilities, equipment, systems, and communication. Coordinates fiscal operations for leader's units, including coordination with SEM fiscal team for oversight of budget coordination, purchase requisitions, contracts, and forecasting. Coordinates purchasing, manages vendor relationships and manages leader travel arrangements as needed. Assists with human resource items, including hiring and candidate search, as needed.Coordinates in the development of programs and/or applies specialized knowledge in the completion of special projects. Conducts research on various issues to prepare recommendations or resolve issues. Attends key meetings, records and transcribes concise and accurate minutes with appropriate distribution. Drafts, edits and finalizes reports and presentations as appropriate. Orders supplies, schedules meeting spaces and assists with special events and catering.This position manages, schedules, and maintains calendar support for the Office of the Vice Provost for Strategic Enrollment Management and its leaders, which may include the Vice Provost and Assistant Vice Provosts. Proactively plans meetings by preparing agendas, needed materials and background information, to ensure timely and strategic follow-up on action items. Manage inquiries, correspondence, and documents on behalf of the SEM Office and its leaders. Supports the Marketing and Strategic communications department's project management system to assist with intake of assigned jobs. Uses Microsoft Office, WorkDay, and other systems to support staff and office operations.Fosters and contributes to a collaborative office culture by supporting the SEM leadership team. Highly resourceful team player with the ability to function effectively independently. Develops and maintains an in-depth knowledge of SEM planning and activities to understand priorities. Applies industry knowledge and a thorough understanding of concepts, principals, and technical capabilities to perform tasks and projects. Collaborates with colleagues across the institution to accomplish tasks. Maintains absolute professional integrity and confidentiality regarding Strategic Enrollment Management matters at all times. Supports the mission, vision, and values of The Ohio State University.Maintains and oversees the reception area and main lobby of the Vice Provost's office suite. Monitors shared email accounts to ensure timely response to all inquiries. Provides support to the SEM Office and backs up the SEM Vice Provost's Executive Assistant as needed. Performs other duties as assigned.Additional InformationMINIMUM REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONSBachelor's degree or equivalent experience. Advanced degree in relevant field may be desirable. 4 years of relevant experience required. 4-8 years of relevant experience preferredFunction: Business Planning & OperationsSub-Function: Business OperationsCareer Band: Individual Contributor - SpecializedCareer Level: S3Applicants are encouraged to apply by April 30, 2024. The hiring range for this position is $62,700-83,600. Offers will vary within this range depending on the unit's available resources.Location:Student Academic Services (0160)Position TypeRegularScheduled Hours40ShiftFirst ShiftFinal candidates are subject to successful completion of a background check. title: Business Analyst
job_description: If you have applied or interviewed for this position within the last 30 days you DO NOT need to reapply you are still in consideration for this opportunity. About UsOur mission is to promote positive, lifelong outcoming for Ohio youth through early intervention, quality education, and family support programs.At DCY, we offer our employees a rewarding work experience in public service helping Ohioans achieve a sustainable lifestyle that includes generous benefit options and a flexible work life balance making our agency a great place to work! Low-cost health care benefits with FREE dental and vision after completed eligibility period Guaranteed 11 paid holidays each year Significant employer paid OPERS contributions Employee tuition reimbursement programs Wellness incentives for healthcare participants And much more!To learn more about DCY, please visit our website at Department of Children and Youth | Ohio.gov.Major Duties And ResponsibilitiesUnder general direction within the Department of Children and Youth's Bureau of Data Analytics and Surveillance, provides program technical assistance to information technology professionals engaged in establishing and enhancing child welfare automated systems Ohio (i.e., Statewide Automated Child Welfare Information System [SACWIS]; Business Intelligence Channel [BIC]; Results Oriented Management [ROM]) and other data systems for storing, processing, and retrieving child welfare information (e.g., adoption and placement data; child abuse and neglect tracking; intake and assessment; resource management; program eligibility and financial tracking): provides program technical assistance to the Division of Information Technology personnel and contractors in determining scope and requirements derived from federal system requirements document (e.g., interprets federal and state statutes to ensure compliance in child welfare automated system design); reviews design documents; plans, develops, and recommends performance criteria and test case scenarios (e.g., creates realistic child welfare scripts); conducts system tests to ensure expected outcomes and to test user scenarios; assists with data conversion from current child welfare automated systems; assists in implementation of new systems; develops marketing material for partner agencies; develops webinars, procedure manuals, and user support documentation; monitors adherence of system development to federal and state requirements; remains current in program policy changes; provides help desk customer service to county Public Children Service Agencies (PCSAs), Title IV-E Juvenile Courts, private non-custodial agencies (PNAs), and private child placing agencies (PCPAs); trains PCSAs, PNAs, and PCPAs to ensure program compliance through use of state's child welfare automation systems; monitors counties' knowledge and use of state's child welfare automation systems by identifying user and/or software problems through help desk activities with PCSAs, PNAs, and PCPAs staff; responds to PCSAs, PNAs, and PCPAs inquiries regarding child welfare automated systems user-related issues; provides technical assistance; determines security profiles for agency staff; analyzes data; creates reports and assists with federal reporting requirements; identifies source of problems and prepares corrective action steps.Serves as a technical assistance expert to Ohio SACWIS and other supporting systems by developing and providing technical assistance and instructional e-learning training for the user community (e.g., PCSAs, Title IV-E Juvenile Courts, PNAs, and PCPAs) on new and modified procedures and other systems-related topics; develops new and/or revises materials using e-learning software and web development tools (e.g., Captivate; PowerPoint; Adobe Premier Pro) (e.g., user guides; desk aids; instructional manuals; YouTube; training videos and webinars); edits and proofreads technical assistance materials provided by other Business Analysts; coordinates the delivery of training and technical assistance (e.g., notifies attendees; ensures audiovisual resources and other technical assistance resources are available and operational; maintains and updates application on screen help files using selected tools); maintains a knowledge base by ensuring all documents, videos, and webinars are relevant to the current functionality; surveys user community to include participant feedback and learning imparted at the conclusion of the instructional e-learning sessions; maintains electronic inventory of all technical assistance provided to the user community; as requested, provides on-site technical assistance through presentations; attends Joint Application Design (JAD) sessions and assists with systems testing of new and current functionality.Performs other related duties as assigned (e.g., attends staff meetings, project meetings, conferences, and training; participates on special assignments; compiles periodic activity and project status reports; operates personal computer to produce correspondence, reports, and other documents; maintains logs, records, and files).Travel required, as needed. Must provide own transportation or, in order to operate a state vehicle, you must have a valid drivers license.Hybrid Work DetailsSubject to DCYs teleworking policy and an approved teleworking agreement, this position is eligible to work from a remote location on a hybrid basis. The selected applicant may be required to complete initial trainings prior to being eligible to telework. All requests to telework are reviewed on a case-by-case basis and must be approved by DCY’s Deputy Director of Human Resources and management, subject to the conditions outlined in the agency policy and teleworking agreement.Drug-Free WorkplaceThe State of Ohio is a drug-free workplace which prohibits the use of marijuana (recreational marijuana/non-medical cannabis). Please note, this position may be subject to additional restrictions pursuant to the State of Ohio Drug-Free Workplace Policy (HR-39), and as outlined in the posting.The following are the minimum qualifications for this position. For further consideration, applicants must clearly identify how qualifications are met within the education and/or experience sections of the applications.Completion of undergraduate core coursework or 2 years exp. in social or behavioral science, pre-medicine, business administration, public administration, human services as defined in series purpose, or comparable field (note: this required education and/or experience shall not be applied to satisfy one of the following), ANDFor State Automated Child Welfare System (SACWIS) positions, requires 24 mos. recent exp. (i.e., within past 5 years) in delivery of human services that included explaining & applying child protective services laws, policies & procedures mandated by Ohio Department of Job & Family Services & using SACWIS; 6 mos. training or 6 mos. exp. in operating personal computer & using Microsoft Office system software, that is Microsoft Word, Excel, Power Point, or like software package. Primary LocationUnited States of America-OHIO-Franklin County-ColumbusWork LocationsChildren&Youth N. High ComplexOrganizationDepartment of Children and YouthClassified IndicatorClassifiedBargaining Unit / ExemptBargaining UnitScheduleFull-timeWork Hours8:00 - 5:00 PMCompensation$31.86 - $44.56 per hourUnposting DateMay 2, 2024, 10:59:00 PMPrimary Job SkillInformation TechnologyTechnical SkillsAccounting and Finance, Human ServicesProfessional SkillsAttention to Detail, Written CommunicationPrimary TechnologyNot ApplicableAgency Contact NameAshley SydebothamAgency Contact InformationAshley.Sydebotham@childrenandyouth.ohio.gov

job_description: Medpace is a full-service clinical contract research organization (CRO).We provide Phase I-IV clinical development services to the biotechnology, pharmaceutical and medical device industries. Our mission is to accelerate the global development of safe and effective medical therapeutics through its scientific and disciplined approach. We leverage local regulatory and therapeutic expertise across all major areas including oncology, cardiology, metabolic disease, endocrinology, central nervous system, anti-viral and anti-infective. Headquartered in Cincinnati, Ohio, employing approximately 4,500+ people across almost 40 countries. Work collaboratively across multiple business and IT stakeholders.Current state process mapping.Design and optimize future state processes.Identify and recommend opportunities for automation.Development of automation solutions through available technologies and tools.Analyze project needs.Discovery / requirements gathering.Developing functional requirements.Work with IT Developers to translate requirements to facilitate development.Developing and executing QC and testing to ensure high quality delivery.Developing wireframes, training, and support documentation. Bachelor’s degree in business, computer science, or related degree.Experience with automation tools and relevant programming languages (e.g., Microsoft Power Platform, RPA, Python/R, SQL).Analytical thinking with great attention to detail.Ability to prioritize multiple projects and tasks.Ability to work independently and lead increasingly large initiatives.Excellent written and verbal communication skills.2+ years of experience in similar roles.

Only candidates who are local to Columbus, Oh will be considered.Business Analyst (Analytics)Job DescriptionThis individual will support providing transparency and visibility to key data and analysis supporting the Value Management Office and delivery teams. They will play a key role in helping define the metrics and measurement of overall delivery effectiveness and end to end flow of work. They will help define data capture requirements, analyze patterns and trends, synthesize information into dashboards or presentations that covey insights and recommendations through storytelling, while maintaining a balance between the big picture and mastery of details.The TeamThe Value Management Office (VMO) is responsible for helping drive a value-focused transformation across the client. The VMO includes the following functions:Working in direct partnership with our Finance and Strategy team to mature to an outcome driven organizationDriving the adoption of agile practices and standardsSupporting continuous prioritization of initiative in partnership with business partnersSupporting value tracking, IT execution alignment, and delivery flowDriving the continued evolution of our operational processes, training, coaching and communicationsProviding visibility through the development of reporting and analysisBasic Qualifications:Master's degree in Decision Sciences, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science or Information Systems, Operations Research, or a STEM degreeIn lieu of a Master's Degree, Bachelor's degree with a minimum of 3 years work experience in analytics or data sciencePreferred QualificationsUnderstanding of IT project execution and delivery including agile delivery best practices, concepts and measure of successExperienced at leveraging both structured and unstructured data sourcesWillingness and ability to learn new technologies on the jobDemonstrated ability to communicate complex results to technical and non-technical audiencesDeveloping and applying statistical or machine learning methods in a corporate environment through applications such as R, Python, or SASBusiness intelligence and data mining tools such as BusinessObjects, MicroStrategy, Tableau and Tableau Server, Alteryx, or SAS Enterprise Guide/MinerProgramming languages Java or C++ in a data mining contextBuilding web-based applications using HTML, CSS, Perl, and JavaScriptFinancial Services backgroundJob ResponsibilitiesWork with stakeholders to ensure that needs are clearly understood and that services meet those needsSynthesize data from our analytics tools into actionable insights. Clearly communicate these recommendations to internal stakeholders and senior leadershipActively participate in cross-functional initiatives, collaborating with team members to measure successAbility to quickly grasp complex technical concepts and make them easily understandable through various communication mediums like visualizations and presentationsCreate compelling, intuitive dashboards to enable the business with critical metrics, with a focus on data automation, anomaly detection, and actionable data visualizationsApply visualization techniques to internal and external data sources to make accurate and actionable analyses in a timely fashionBe a partner in the building of KPIs and metrics that help to gauge the health and success of our initiativesCreate self-service dashboards for internal business partners to learn, understand, have access to, and derive insights from data, metrics, and KPIsApply automation techniques to manual processes to create efficiency, improve accuracy, and build upon successes that create a suite of self-service assetsFor more information about this opportunity, please contact Bill Hart at 614-352-3615 AND email your resume to bill.hart@centralpointpartners.com!

job_description: Here is the job details for your review;Job Title : " Business Analyst - Senior "Duration : 3+ months with goal to keep the candidate for longer duration or possible convert.Location : Hybrid: 240 W Nationwide Blvd, Columbus, Ohio 43215 United States - Tuesday and WednesdayShift : 8:00AM 5:00PM Monday - FridayQualificationsComplete Job description:Data Engineering Experience Technology Operations Experience Data Lake and Azure Dev Ops Strong Communication Skills Self-Driven 7+ years experience in role with: Experience, knowledge, and exposure to various project delivery methodologies (Waterfall, Iterative, Agile) Strong process orientation and analytical problem solving skills including the ability to interpret and clarify technical issues Demonstrated facilitation skills, written and verbal communications skills, organizational skills, and the ability to deliver clear, concise presentations Demonstrated team spirit with strong adaptability, openness to feedback, and the ability to work cooperatively and creatively across an organization Demonstrated strong leadership skills Proficiency with Microsoft Office products including Visio Demonstrated experience working under tight deadlines Demonstrated experience working independently in high-priority situations Demonstrated understanding of business case justification methodology used to recommend process improvements or technology enhancements Demonstrated excellent interpersonal skills Demonstrated ability to manage conflict Experience with ITIL Utility background preferred where appropriate Certified Business Analyst Professional (or related certification) ITIL v3 or v4 a plus"Responsibilities"A NiSource Business Analyst will: Facilitates the gathering of business requirements of Customer Entities for new scope and/or functionality for existing and/or new Applications associated with Customer's business process(es), in addition to gathering and reporting the non-functional requirements. Works with Solution Architect to confirm all requirements are met with recommended solution. Coordinates user acceptance testing with the business. Manages IT processes designed to prioritize and enable implementation of solutions to meet new business requirements of Customer. Provides clear communication to Customer's business unit and IT leaders (as specified by Customer) on the status of maintenance, enhancements and new Projects. Works as a member of a team or independently to perform a functional role in support of the solution construction, implementation, and system integration in a technology/industry specialty. Responds to varying business requirements. Performs many assigned functional tasks including study, analysis, design and testing. Provides analytical ability and creativity in developing, implementing, and documenting solution deliverables for Projects. Provides business and functional advice to Project Managers and Team Leads, as well as, gives business and functional direction to team members including service providers or their approved subcontractors. Participates in translation of business requirements of Customer Entities into specific system, Application or process designs (this includes working as a team member with Customer personnel to identify functional and non-functional requirements and subsequently working on the identification, justification and design of the solution for Customer). Participates in multiple design and documentation activities, from requirements analysis to systems, Application and/or process design specification, and associated functional training materials. Be extreme"Comments/Special InstructionsHybrid - Tuesday and Wednesdays in office, no additional travel will be paid unless pre-approved, no overtime will be paid unless approved.

title: Business Analyst - Level 2 - Dynamics 365
job_description: Requisition Number: 170817Job DescriptionThe Cintas Technology & Analytics team is looking for a qualified Dynamics 365 solutions consultant to administer, configure, and develop technical solutions for our sales technology platform.Job Responsibilities Administration and configuration of Microsoft Dynamics CRM.  Provide application support to end users.  Configure system enhancements and processes in Dynamics 365 to make sure the system supports the needs of business stakeholders.  Review and create CRM customizations including plugins, JavaScript/HTML, Power Automate flows, custom HTML interfaces (web resources), data integrations/migrations, and SSRS processes.  Configure and generate Microsoft Dynamics CRM dashboards and reports.  Serve as system technical liaison between business partners and technical resources as well as collaborate with other IT developers and analysts.  Maintenance of data in Microsoft Dynamics CRM. Manage data imports, exports, and integrations with other systems; ensure data quality, accuracy, and compliance with Cintas standards. title: IS Business Analyst

title: Sr. Business Analyst - Consolidation
job_description: Senior Business Analyst - Consolidation: A Pivotal Role in Financial Planning & AnalysisAre you ready to be the cornerstone of our FP&A organization? As a Senior Business Analyst - Consolidation, you’ll report directly to the Senior Director of Finance – FP&A and play a crucial role in shaping the financial future of our company.What You'll Do:Lead and Innovate: Drive the administration and preparation of monthly forecasts, annual budgets, and strategic financial analyses. Analyze and Advise: Provide senior management with insightful analysis of consolidated financial results, including P&L, balance sheet, and cash flow across various business dimensions. Ensure Compliance: Assist in audit procedures and capital project justifications, including EVA analysis and lease/buy decisions. Collaborate and Guide: Act as the finance liaison for cross-functional teams and monitor performance against key company targets and metrics. Report and Influence: Perform ad-hoc reporting and assist in special projects to analyze complex business situations and foster growth. Your Path Forward: This role isn’t just a job; it’s a stepping stone to a Finance Manager position, serving as the key consolidation point for the Senior Director of Finance.Key Responsibilities:Forge efficiencies and process improvements. Partner with finance leaders to support financial analysis needs. Develop and report budgets and forecasts for Matco. Manage financial aspects of special projects. Conduct monthly reporting and variance analysis. Assess product margins and business unit performance. Career Progression: Your journey can lead to roles such as Plant Controller or Sr. Director within Finance, or managerial positions across Matco and Vontier.A strategic thinker with a Bachelor’s Degree in Finance/Accounting; a Graduate Degree is a plus. Someone with 5-8 years of financial/business experience and a proven track record in budgeting/forecasting. A master of Excel and financial modeling, with a keen analytical mind and strong presentation skills. Knowledgeable in GAAP, Hyperion, and J D Edwards systems. Fit Factors:Tenacity and a ‘do what it takes’ attitude. Exceptional time management and organizational skills. Leadership qualities that inspire teamwork and create followership. Unwavering honesty and integrity. Strong communication and team-building abilities. The capacity to manage multiple priorities and maintain attention to detail. Join us and be the force that drives financial excellence within Matco. Apply now to take the next step in your career!Matco Tools, a wholly owned subsidiary of Vontier Corporation, is a distributor of quality professional automotive equipment, tools, and toolboxes. Matco began operation in 1946 and, since 1979, has sold products directly to professional mechanics, enthusiasts, and those who value quality tools through a network of independent franchised mobile distributors who operate in all 50 states, Puerto Rico, and Canada. Products are also sold to central purchasing operations and other institutional customers through industrial sales representatives and via the internet. Matco is a franchising company, a distribution company, a financing company, a manufacturer of industry leading toolboxes, and a leading supplier of automotive technology solutions employing approximately 600 associates in the United States, Puerto Rico and Canada. For more information on Matco Tools, visit www.matcotools.com.BenefitsAnnual bonuses/incentives (depending on position)Immediate Company Benefits (medical, Dental, Vision, Life, Etc.)401k with company match401k defined contribution after 1 year of serviceHigh level of employee engagementWalking path and gym equipment onsiteFood trucks on site during the summerDress for your day - every day casual/jeansEmployee discounts15 days vacation + 4 floating holidays + 8 paid holidaysPaid maternity & paternity leaveTuition reimbursementStudent loan payment assistanceHybrid work environment (2 days remote)Annual Day of Caring for employees to volunteerDiscounts on toolsAnnual team building eventsVontier (NYSE: VNT) is a global industrial technology company uniting critical mobility and multi-energy technologies and solutions to meet the needs of a rapidly evolving, more connected mobility ecosystem. Leveraging leading market positions, decades of domain expertise and unparalleled portfolio breadth, Vontier enables the way the world moves – delivering smart, safe, and sustainable solutions to our customers and the planet. Vontier has a culture of continuous improvement built upon the foundation of the Vontier Business System and embraced by over 8,500 colleagues worldwide. title: Business Controls Analyst - Mortgage Non Performing Servicing
job_description: Make banking a Fifth Third better®We connect great people to great opportunities. Are you ready to take the next step? Discover a career in banking at Fifth Third Bank.General FunctionAs first line of defense, conducts analysis related to identifying, assessing, mitigating, and managing risks necessary to comply with new or changing laws, regulations, regulatory guidance, and best practices deemed necessary by key stakeholders (such as Legal, Compliance, Enterprise Risk and Audit partners). Supports Business Controls in advancing risk management, structure, processes, and tools in support of the organization’s Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) framework. Transforms data into business intelligence by developing and presenting information and insights to stakeholders. Monitors and manages risks to ensure compliance and validation of program effectiveness with assigned line of business or functional area, and Bancorp initiatives.Responsible and accountable for risk by openly exchanging ideas and opinions, elevating concerns, and personally following policies and procedures as defined. Accountable for always doing the right thing for customers and colleagues, and ensures that actions and behaviors drive a positive customer experience. While operating within the Bank’s and LOB’s risk appetites, achieves results by consistently identifying, assessing, managing, monitoring, and reporting risks of all types.Essential Duties And ResponsibilitiesAssists Business Controls leadership with the implementation of controls, policies, and procedures to increase effectiveness and efficiency related to the respective business or functional area.Provides relevant expertise and analysis to stakeholders related to the identification, assessment, control, monitoring, testing and reporting of risks.Investigates and assists in root cause analysis in instances of actual or potential operational loss.Gathers, analyzes, aggregates, and reports on risk data to develop solutions to analytical, implementation, and/or execution issues.Prepares status reports and presentations to keep Business Controls leadership and internal partners abreast of key milestones, alternatives, and potential risks.Develop knowledge of industry best practices and regulations to ensure compliance with all applicable laws, standards, and requirements, including, but not limited to, OCC Heightened Standards.Supports the resolution of internal audit, compliance, or risk management related issues that could impact the classification, availability, or integrity of data or processes.Highlights control breakdowns, inadequate processes, and unexpected events and implements corrective actions in partnership with Business Controls leadership to address process and control deficiencies.Builds effective relationships with other internal business control groups and the second and third lines of defense (such as Legal, Compliance, Enterprise Risk, and Audit).Collaborates with groups responsible for ensuring adequate information barriers are established, and the Bank’s compliance with policies and processes are in place in order to control the flow of certain information.Assists with execution of regulatory change management program to ensure applicable regulatory changes are identified, assessed against business processes, reported, and complied with.Partners with business managers in implementing remediation actions per the Bancorp issues management framework and assists in the coordination of business ownership of processes, risks, controls, and tests.May assist in the coordination for updates to archive systems (e.g., Open Pages, PPM, etc.).May help to conduct RCSA facilitated sessions where risks and controls are rated.May, if applicable, assist in the external change management for credit bureau working with centralized team and Business Controls leadership as build out testing.Works with LOB to identify initial set of inherent risks and controls and identifies applicable governance processes.May assist in the determination of identifying loss events with applicable RCSA risks/processes and coordinate root cause analysis and action plans evaluation with LOB.Partner with support functions or risk experts to identify applicable Enterprise and risk appetite indicators.Collaborate with LOB on threshold evaluation and proposed changes and enter proposed indicators and changes in the GRC tool.Actively participates in issue remediation.Executes on ERM Scenario Analysis risk management program.Develop and manage product inventory and execute on ERM product risk review program.May have additional responsibilities as assigned by LOB/Function leadership and Risk, including but not limited to:Assistance with new government programs or special internal projects.Assistance with new risk programs required by regulatory authorities or ERM.Assistance with diligence, closing, and other matters relating to acquisitions and strategic investments.Minimum Knowledge And Skills RequiredBachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required (related field preferred).1-2 years of financial services industry, risk, business controls or compliance experience preferred.Professional verbal and written communication skills and the ability to communicate with discretion and understanding when confidentiality is needed.Must be analytical and possess ability to interpret and apply policies and regulations across a complex business.Must identify opportunities and take action to build trusting strategic internal and external relationships and networks.Must be approachable and collaborative, thrive in a fast-paced dynamic environment, and be comfortable quickly shifting priorities on short notice.Working knowledge of Microsoft Office products required.Ability to work with minimal supervision.FINRA Series 7 and 63/66 licenses preferred.Knowledge of the Securities industry and SEC / FINRA regulations is preferred.Business Controls Analyst - Mortgage Non Performing ServicingLOCATION -- Cincinnati, Ohio 45227Fifth Third Bank, National Association is proud to have an engaged and inclusive culture and to promote and ensure equal employment opportunity in all employment decisions regardless of race, color, gender, national origin, religion, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, military status, veteran status or any other legally protected status.

title: BHIS Business Applications Analyst
job_description: OverviewThe BHIS System Analyst will provide a comprehensive approach in delivering excellence in data analytic support for all the Behavioral Health multidisciplinary service areas. Responsible for querying, analyzing, and disseminating reports. Types of reporting include patient volumes, utilization management, business surveys, quality initiatives, dashboard development, and ad hoc requests. Works with Behavioral Health administrative and medical staff, Planning and the Data Resource Center, Business Intelligence, Quality Improvement as well as external organizations to ensure the availability of timely and accurate information, upon which operational, strategic and programmatic decisions will be made. Why Nationwide Children's Hospital? The moment you walk through our doors, you feel it. When you meet our patient families, you believe it. And when you talk with anyone who works here, you want to be part of it. Welcome to Nationwide Children’s Hospital,  Where Passion Meets Purpose .Here, Diversity, Equity and Inclusion  are integrated into our core values and practices. We are passionate about building, sustaining and evolving an inclusive and equitable environment. We are seeking individuals who live these values and want to share their experiences and efforts in support of our collective mission.We’re 14,000 strong. And it takes every one of us to improve the lives of the kids we care for, and the kids around the world we’ll never meet. Kids who live healthier, fuller lives because of the knowledge we share. We know it takes  a Collaborative Culture to deliver on our promise to provide the very best, innovative care and to foster new discoveries, made possible by the most groundbreaking research. Anywhere.Ask anyone with a Nationwide Children’s badge what they do for a living. They’ll tell you it’s  More Than a Job . It’s a calling. It’s a chance to use and grow your talent to make an impact that truly matters. Because here, we exist simply to help children everywhere.Nationwide Children’s Hospital.  A Place to Be Proud .Responsibilities Writes SQL code to obtain relevant data at patient level and develop dashboards to provide meaningful information for use in operational, strategic and programmatic decisions. Supports clinical staff data activities, including productivity/ benchmarking, professional activity, monthly reporting, and ad hoc data requests. Maintains knowledge of appropriate software and visualization tools including python/r/ STATA, SQL, and Power BI. Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high level information into technical details and conceptualize technical details in a format that can be shared with stakeholders. Maintains strict adherence to all HIPAA rules and regulations regarding the confidentiality of patient information. Drives definition of scope and development methodology for information requests by gathering information from stakeholders. Once developed, queries required data and presents it to requesting client in user-friendly format. Participates in collaborative meetings with internal and external stakeholders to meet goals, objectives and responsibilities and actively participates and supports all Epic upgrades and or enhancements by providing data needed for implementation and ensuring build functions as anticipated.Education Qualifications  Bachelor’s or equivalent experience required. Possible fields of study include Statistics, Health Informatics, Computer Science, or other related fieldSkills Analytical skills to assemble, evaluate and understand large and complex information sets, and to identify current and future trends. Excellent communication and organizational skills to effectively interact with external contacts, administrator, medical staff and employees at all levels. Ability to communicate difficult or complex information. Ability to successfully engage in multiple project initiatives simultaneously and work independently under minimal supervision.Experience Minimum one-year proficiency in programming languages such as STATA/ R/Python, expertise in query languages like SQL, and experience with visualization tools such as Power BI and survey tools like RedCap. Familiarity with healthcare coding systems (including ICD, DSM, CPT, MSDRG, APRDRG, CRG) as well as experience using medical terminology. Experience with electronic health records, preferably EPIC.The above list of duties is intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by individuals assigned to this classification.
