title: Firmwide Resiliency Product Analyst Associate (602)
job_description: Job DescriptionGiven the critical role JPMC plays in the world economy, resiliency remains a key area of focus for the firm. The Firmwide Business Resiliency (FBR) group within the Office of the CFO is responsible for ensuring the adequacy of the Firmwide Resiliency Program in the event of disruption. Working with key business and support partners, the team is responsible for providing corporate governance, awareness, tooling, and training. We are seeking a highly motivated product analyst. The ideal candidate is stakeholder obsessed and committed to delivering a product with an amazing user experience while strongly supporting the overall Business Resiliency Uplift Program.As a Firmwide Resiliency Product Analyst Associate within the Firmwide Business Resiliency group, you will play a key role in ensuring the adequacy of the Firmwide Resiliency Program in the event of disruption. You will work closely with key business and support partners, providing corporate governance, awareness, tooling, and training. Your role will involve collecting user requirements, performing in-depth analysis, writing Epics and Stories, and maintaining the product backlog. This role offers the opportunity to work closely with User Experience (UX) teams on the design of new features and components, and with User Acceptance Testing (UAT) teams to ensure test coverage.Job ResponsibilitiesForming strong bonds and a healthy working relationship with the scrum teams they work withCollecting user requirements and feedback from business partners and project leads in formal and informal settings; Juggling multiple projects at any given time, all with vigorous delivery expectationsPerforming in depth analysis for fact finding on existing behavior of the system and business processes or procedures related to the project goalDemonstrating ability to feel comfortable discussing functional details of workflows, and generally comfortable discussing technical information at a high level.Writing Epics and Stories to deliver features fulfilling the project goals; Act as Subject Matter Expert on area product owned systemsMaintaining and prioritizing the product backlog along with Business Analysts, refining Epics and Stories in JIRA with Scrum team, and partnering with Agile lead (scrum master) on sequencingWorking closely with User Experience (UX) teams on design of new features and components. Working with User Acceptance Testing (UAT) teams to ensure test coverage; Building relationships with ‘co-supplier’ stakeholders from multiple regions and products areasRequired Qualifications, Capabilities, And Skills3+ years Product analyst or analysis role Must have the ability easily assimilate information and learn new applications and processes.Experience with agile product development and software delivery lifecycleAgile Experience with tools such as Jira and understanding of Backlog Prioritization TechniquesAdvanced knowledge of communication and efficiency tools such as SharePoint, Confluence, MS office apps, and JIRAMust have a solid ability to analyze user procedures and workflows, and compare those to project requirements and goals, and to create feature enhancements or new workflows as a result of that analysisEffective communicator with excellent written and verbal communication skills. Capable of developing relationships positively, especially when working through challenging situationsPreferred Qualifications, Capabilities, And SkillsProven track record of delivery and new product feature creationFamiliarity with the business services and offerings associated with ChaseDemonstrated ability to manage tight delivery timelines and calmness under pressureABOUT USJPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world’s most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.We offer a competitive total rewards package including base salary determined based on the role, experience, skill set, and location. For those in eligible roles, we offer discretionary incentive compensation which may be awarded in recognition of firm performance and individual achievements and contributions. We also offer a range of benefits and programs to meet employee needs, based on eligibility. These benefits include comprehensive health care coverage, on-site health and wellness centers, a retirement savings plan, backup childcare, tuition reimbursement, mental health support, financial coaching and more. Additional details about total compensation and benefits will be provided during the hiring process.We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. We also make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs. Visit our FAQs for more information about requesting an accommodation.JPMorgan Chase is an Equal Opportunity Employer, including Disability/VeteransAbout The TeamOur professionals in our Corporate Functions cover a diverse range of areas from finance and risk to human resources and marketing. Our corporate teams are an essential part of our company, ensuring that we’re setting our businesses, clients, customers and employees up for success.

title: Digital Marketing Analyst
job_description: Flexjet, a leading provider of fractional private jet ownership and leasing, is currently seeking a qualified candidate to join the Global Marketing Department as the Digital Marketing Analyst. This role will monitor and track marketing trends, statistics, campaign performance, lead attribution, UX/UI, competitive footprint, website performance and the organization's overall digital visibility. The ideal candidate should have a strong background in analyzing digital marketing statistics and campaign and lead reports to present insights to the team that will drive data-driven decision-making. This position will collaborate with the digital team and IT department as well as serve sister brands within the Directional Aviation family of companies.Flexjet offers an array of private jets - some of the most modern in the fractional jet industry. Flexjet’s clients include corporations and ultra-high-net-worth individuals. Red Label by Flexjet is a key differentiator that offers flight crews dedicated to a single aircraft and over 40 different interior designs under the LXi Cabin Collection of interiors.DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:Monitor, track and report on trends, statistics, campaign performance, lead attribution and website performance.Implement and manage data streams through various business intelligence tools and automation platforms to visualize multiple data points for executive reports.Collect and analyze customer data, marketing insights and competitive intel to provide meaningful data insights that support strategic business positioning.Analyze Flexjet and sister company’s SEO and SEM data (including paid search, pay-per-click advertising, and digital Banner Ads) to generate valuable data insights to reach a highly targeted niche audience and drive them to relevant websites.Develop and present learnings from your analyses, including actionable insight and recommendations.Collaborate with the Cyber Studio and teams across the marketing department to develop digital campaign and web measurement strategies.Identify ways to grow new leads, including marketing-qualified leads, by improving key conversion points in the marketing funnel including landing pages, calls-to-action (CTAs), and lead-generating forms.Analyze Flexjet’s marketing automation and lead nurturing data points and provide insights that will drive recommended optimizations to increase automation flow and lead quality.Prepare detailed weekly, monthly and quarterly reports on the status of website performance, advertising campaign performance and cost versus effectiveness.Analyze historical data to identify trends, opportunities and problems to develop actionable suggestions on strategy.Build dashboards to enable collaboration with fellow marketing managers to optimize conversion paths for marketing campaigns.Create and implement new projects that help improve customer conversion rates.Conduct regular competitive research on other products and companies in our industry. QualificationsEDUCATION & EXPERIENCEA bachelor’s degree in marketing, economics, statistics, math or a related discipline preferred.3+ years of experience using Google Analytics, DOMO, Salesforce, Pardot, GoogleAds 360, Datorama, Quantcast, Super metrics, and GMT (or similar platforms) to conduct in-depth web analytics.3+ years of experience in using platforms similar to Crazy Egg, Hotjar, Moat, Google Data Studio, GoogleAds, DOMO, Datorama.Must have a strong understanding of search engine optimization (SEO) and search engine marketing (SEM).Must have a strong understanding of digital marketing programs and technologies.Must be highly proficient with Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint.Must be a problem solver ready to provide suggestions on how to improve our digital footprint’s experience and drive conversions.Ability to meet deadlines, must be comfortable prioritizing tasks, demonstrate flexibility, display a strong work ethic fanatical attention to detail, and sense of urgency.Innovative and creative thinker; proactively identifies opportunities; motivated by challenge, change and opportunity to help Flexjet look at things differently.Ability to prioritize and complete multiple projects simultaneously, and work in a team environment.Ability to effectively communicate with C-level executives.Ability to accept feedback and work collaboratively as part of a team while still advocating a clear creative vision.5% travel is expected.Must work from our corporate headquarters in Cleveland, OH.

title: Digital Product Delivery Lead Analyst
job_description: Job DescriptionIT Analyst Lead OTC (Order to cash) is responsible for assisting in software implementation, and managing Sherwin’s oracle financial product delivery team with respect to Accounts receivables, Cash, General ledger, Credit and collections, account reconciliation and integrations with boundary applications. The incumbent will lead a team of business analysts and partner with the Business Transformation team, Global Business Owners, and other DT teams to execute the rollout of Oracle ERP cloud across the globe. The role will be responsible for working in a hybrid agile environment, leading sprint sessions, assisting in gathering user requirements and configuring and testing the ERP system within the Oracle ecosystem and across to boundary systems in the Global finance products Arena. Provide product expertise and business knowledge to ensure the solution is configured & leveraged to SW’s best advantage, while also researching Oracle cloud solutions that will elevate the user experience. Proven solution management and communication skills, problem-solving skills, SOX requirements, project/implementation experience and knowledge of best practices are critical to successful performance in this role. In conjunction with working with our internal employees, this role will also work closely with our multiple consulting partners/external hires, software vendors and will require strong knowledge of Sherwin practices, processes, and culture.Responsibilities Support and Lead efforts on the transition from project to product delivery for Digital Technology solutions in alignment with the strategic goals of Digital Technology and S-W leadership.  Lead Collaborations effectively with business unit leaders to define the business capabilities and experiences to be enabled by product teams.  Aid with driving digital effectiveness through strategic thinking and influence, while providing value to business partners  Ensure that applications meet business requirements and systems goals, fulfill end-user requirements, and identify and resolve systems issues, while maintaining a strategic partnership with software vendors to ensure Sherwin needs are identified via enhancement requests and private preview options.  Effectively lead meetings with multiple stakeholders across business, IT, and implementation partner.  Initiate and facilitate the use of Jira to help alleviate the use of manual spreadsheets for project tracking.  Assist the EDO data team in extracting and determining standardization for cloud fields.  Collaborates with programs, products, and projects to understand technology dependencies, risks, and opportunities while working with the IT Functional/Technical Manager to translate that collaboration into developing technical solutions to solve for software functionality gaps.  Support team members with building ERP and cloud skills, including training, skills assessment.  Partner with the Business Transformation organization to build user stories that will ensure business scenarios are well outlined.  Assist in bridging the gap between cloud ERP and all associated boundary systems by ensuring that the functional requirements for the boundary system are being satisfied by data from the cloud.  Work closely with the Platform team on functional and technical specs for extensions and reports QualificationsFORMAL EDUCATION: Required: Bachelor’s degree (or foreign equivalent) in a Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Information Technology field of study (e.g., Information Technology, Electronics and Instrumentation Engineering, Computer Systems Management, Mathematics) or equivalent experience. KNOWLEDGE & EXPERIENCE:Required: 8+ years IT experience  5+ years of Oracle application experience in any of the following modules: Accounts Receivable, Advanced Collections, Credit Management, iReceivables, Subledger Accounting (SLA), eBusiness Tax, Payables, General Ledger  5+ years’ experience of ERP implementation experience  2+ years of implementing or utilizing agile methodologies in a technology organization.  Experience or knowledge of basic SOX requirements for financial software and reporting  Demonstrated analytical thinking, organizational skills, and problem-solving skills.  Proven ability to lead initiatives and meet timelines.  Exceptional communication skills  High skilled in being able to manage large projects initiatives.  Understanding of various essential business functions of an organization  Proven ability to collaborate across large organizations.  Ability to make quick decisions, while managing to low-risk solutions Preferred: 2+ years of working knowledge of oracle cloud ERP applications.  Experience working in High radius collections cloud applications and integrations.  Basic Accounting Knowledge of financials  Oracle ERP Cloud Experience  PMP, Agile certification TECHNICAL/SKILL REQUIREMENTS:Required: Ability to understand underlying ERP Finance process with respect to Finance ERP Oracle modules  Basic SQL skills  Ability to manage/support/update key stakeholders.  Understanding of Finance accounting concepts, Oracle finance On-prem/Cloud ERP modules  Strong understanding of security roles/responsibilities with ERP finance systems  Strong Commitment to inclusion and Diversity Preferred: Working knowledge of Service Now & Jira for managing enterprise digital workflows  Working knowledge of Oracle ERP cloud finance modules This position is not eligible for sponsorship for work authorization now or in the future, including conversion to H1-B visa.This position is eligible to work in the office three days a week and has the option to work remotely two days a week. About UsHere, we believe there’s not one path to success, we believe in careers that grow with you. Whoever you are or wherever you come from in the world, there’s a place for you at Sherwin-Williams. We provide you with the opportunity to explore your curiosity and drive us forward. Sherwin-Williams values the unique talents and abilities from all backgrounds and characteristics. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply, including individuals with disabilities and Protected Veterans. We’ll give you the space to share your strengths and we want you show us what you can do. You can innovate, grow and discover in a place where you can thrive and Let Your Colors Show!At Sherwin-Williams, part of our mission is to help our employees and their families live healthier, save smarter and feel better. This starts with a wide range of world-class benefits designed for you. From retirement to health care, from total well-being to your daily commute—it matters to us. A general description of benefits offered can be found at http://www.myswbenefits.com/ . Click on “Candidates” to view benefit offerings that you may be eligible for if you are hired as a Sherwin-Williams employee.Compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case and will impact where actual compensation may fall within the stated wage range. The wage range listed for this role takes into account the wide range of factors considered in making compensation decisions including skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled.The wage range, other compensation, and benefits information listed is accurate as of the date of this posting. The Company reserves the right to modify this information at any time, with or without notice, subject to applicable law.Sherwin-Williams is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer committed to an inclusive and diverse workplace. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, age, pregnancy, genetic information, creed, marital status or any other consideration prohibited by law or by contract.As a VEVRAA Federal Contractor, Sherwin-Williams requests state and local employment services delivery systems to provide priority referral of Protected Veterans.

title: Digital Analyst - Ecommerce & Advertising
job_description: As an integral part of our ecommerce team, you will manage Amazon Advertising, Google Ads, and other third-party product advertising campaigns. You will need strong analytic skills including advertising analysis across various platforms and frequent ad hoc analysis of sales, operations, and advertising-related performance data. You should have a tech mindset and be very comfortable using online systems, services, and applications. Two or more years of digital advertising and analysis experience is required and solid knowledge of MS Excel, lookups and pivot tables is mandatory.ResponsibilitiesWork with the digital marketing team to conceptualize creative strategies for advertising and marketing campaigns using Google Ads, Amazon Ads and other services for 1P and 3P products.Strategize and implement advertising campaigns for Google Search and SEO optimization.Perform reporting and analysis for advertising, sales, and operations related to ecommerceDay-to-day management of ad campaigns at a detailed levelConduct keyword research to create lists of keywords that will speak to the appropriate audiences.Develop and manage Amazon product advertising through the Amazon ads manager.Conduct marketing research to stay current with recent trends and ideas to target new audiences effectively.Develop and manage digital advertising to help achieve sales goals.Collaborate with the digital marketing team on the strategy and creation of assets for advertising.Skills and QualificationsAbility to work well independently and in a team setting.You must love working in a digital commerce environment.Proficiency in Microsoft Office or Google Suite.Good attention to detail and an analytic mind.Organization skills and ability to set and meet deadlines.

title: Content Capability Analyst
job_description: CAS uses intuitive technology, unparalleled scientific content, and unmatched human expertise to help companies create groundbreaking innovations that benefit the world. As the scientific information solutions division of the American Chemical Society, CAS manages the largest curated reservoir of scientific knowledge, and for 115 years, has helped innovators mine, assess and apply that information to keep businesses thriving. The CAS team is global, diverse, endlessly curious and strives to make scientific insights accessible to innovators worldwide.CAS is currently seeking a Content Capability Analyst. This position will be located in Columbus, OH.The Senior Content Capability Analyst will work with Product Business Analysts to translate business needs for various products/services initiatives into actionable requirements for the agile development teams. They need to understand the content domains used by the product and work closely with the Product Business Analysts, Data Governance members, Data Architects, Scrum Masters, and agile development and QA team members to clarify content needs and resolve requirements discrepancies.Duties Ensures strong understanding of business needs across domains and applications  Closely collaborates with Product Business Analysts and is accountable for development of actionable requirements for one or more agile teams  Provides day-to-day guidance to on-/off-team developers and technicians across a broad array of business requirements  Clarifies ambiguous or evolving requirements to ensure teams continue to provide maximum business value.  Assists developers and testers in translating and understanding nuances and critical details associated with requirements  Document, Analyze and Solve data quality issues as prioritized by stakeholders  Document and maintain data flow process diagrams, mapping specifications, dictionaries, and lineage  Provide escalation for requirements issues with one or more teams  Adheres to the approach to high quality requirements  Identifies complex problems, escalates them promptly to appropriate stakeholders, and resolves those of high priority.  Collaborates with colleagues/management in a wide variety of roles and organizational levels to facilitate identification, dialogue and alignment of risks, issues, priorities, and actions. Builds alignment of team and sponsor decisions.  Influences colleagues, including colleagues in more senior roles, to help plan complex efforts that will deliver on the needs expressed by stakeholders.  Mentors less experienced colleagues in similar roles. Qualifications Bachelor of Science degree  3+ years of experience as a business analyst  5+ years of experience in scientific information content industry  Possesses excellent verbal and written communication skills  Excellent team, collaboration, and facilitation skills  Results oriented  Ability to work independently  Possesses strong work ethics Desired Experienced in requirements gathering  Expertise in use of software development tools  Understanding of the software development process  Demonstrated success in Agile teams CAS offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package, including a generous vacation plan, medical, dental, vision insurance plans, and employee savings and retirement plans. Candidates for this position must be authorized to work in the United States and not require work authorization sponsorship by our company for this position now or in the future. EEO/Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran.

title: Enterprise Architect/Business Analyst with Security Clearance
job_description: Overview ENTERPRISE ARCHITECT/BUSINESS ANALYST (EAS): Bowhead is seeking an experienced Enterprise Architect/Business Analyst to join our team located at Wright-Patterson AFB, OH. The position supports the US Air Force and candidates with Department of Defense Architecture Framework (DoDAF) and military business process experience are highly encouraged to apply. ResponsibilitiesAnalyzes complex business organizations, processes, and personnel to model organizational capabilities.Experience with Value Stream Mapping and identifying toil processes.Experience with system and software requirements, DoD cybersecurity policy and strategy, flowcharting, and software development artifacts.Experience with ARIS or other Enterprise Architecture software tool.Ability to lead workshops with both customers and co-workers, participate in peer reviews, and adhere to strict architecture/business process standards and styles.Prior military experience is a plus and a diverse familiarity with supply, logistics, aircraft, maintenance, and personnel/human resources. About this Contract: Bowhead provides Enterprise and System Architecture Support to the US Air Force Life Cycle Management Center at Gunter Annex in Montgomery, Alabama. Work site is Wright-Patterson AFB, OH. The AFLCMC/GBE Enterprise Architecture Services Group encompass the following disciplines within architecture: application or solution architecture, data architecture, and architecture maintenance. title: Compliance Analyst
job_description: THIS ROLE IS 100% ONSITE:Welcome to Western & Southern Financial Group – Our focus on creating value for our customers through everything we do is foundational to who we are. We provide meaningful and challenging work for our associates, a key facet of our incredible culture that helps make Western & Southern a career destination. More than 135 years of operating history;Born as a modest, door-to-door life insurance business and built to last foreverRanked 314 on Fortune 500Award winning Talent Development TeamTop 10 for Top Spouse Employer and Military Friendly Employer in 2023We consider Cincinnati the best place to live, work and celebrate life – that is why we are committed to doing good for our communityOur CultureWe are building our company to thrive and provide value to our customers, business partners and associates over the long term. To accomplish this, we look for professionals who embody our culture of integrity, top-notch performance, collaboration and teamwork. We are committed to hiring and developing associates who are driven to excel, have a strong work ethic and use astute, fact-based and ethical judgment in decision-making.A Day in the Life The Compliance Analyst is responsible for assisting senior staff in identifying key risk factors, including; researching and identifying regulatory requirements, documenting the control environment designed to comply with stated requirements, assessing nature of risk factors, and identifying gaps in the control process. Skill sets served include but are not limited to someone with up to 2 years of experience in compliance with a proven ability to receive, organize, and manage large amounts of diverse information and documentation. Duties and ResponsibilitiesTracks changes in SRO, federal and state rules and regulators; identifies related policies and procedures, and updates as needed.Provides review of retail communications for the Firm as well as email reviews, escalating to the Manager when issues are discovered.Conducts AML surveillance, review, and reporting.Works with the Compliance Manager to monitor branch supervisory turnover, assignments, and production of Form BR, assisting in the maintenance of all books and records related to this activity.Desired Competencies and Skills:Demonstrated strong quantitative and analytical skills, including experience identifying, defining and resolving problems and collecting or interpreting data to establish facts and draw valid conclusions.Proven experience coordinating multiple complex projects/assignments simultaneously on a timely and accurate basis with a strong attention to detail. Bachelor’s degree or commensurate experience within financial services.FINRA Series 7, 24, 52/53, 63 or 65/66 preferredFINRA Series 6 within three months of hire; FINRA Series 26 and any applicable other registration for the state of residence within six months of hire. To view the full job description please visit – https://careers-westernsouthern.icims.com/jobs/20047/compliance-analyst/job Premier Benefits to Support YOUComprehensive benefits including medical, dental, vision, prescription, pet insurance, life insurance, disability, Fertility, maternity/caregiver & parental leave, and more!Retirement solution with our 401(k) savings AND pension plan!Paid time off that increases with tenure.Tuition Reimbursement Subsidized affordable parkingOn-site Cafeteria and fitness center (including sports leagues)On-site Registered NurseCareer Coaching/MentoringIndividualized development plans and career pathingLearn more about who we are visit; www.westernsouthern.com/careers/home-office-careers. title: Risk Management - Business Manager - Senior Associate
job_description: Job DescriptionBring your expertise to JPMorgan Chase. As a Risk Management - Business Manager - Associate in Risk Management and Compliance, you are at the center of keeping JPMorgan Chase strong and resilient. You help the firm grow its business in a responsible way by anticipating new and emerging risks, and using your expert judgement to solve real-world challenges that impact our company, customers and communities. Our culture in Risk Management and Compliance is all about thinking outside the box, challenging the status quo and striving to be best-in-class.This role requires direct interaction with the BB Risk Chief of Staff and senior executives on a regular basis. Strong verbal and written communication skills are a necessity. Business Management requires impromptu presentations, explanations, research and problem solving. Relationships with critical partners inside and outside the sub-LOB can be the difference between success or failure.The Associate role will report directly to the BB Risk Chief of Staff. We need a teammate who is intellectually curious, a strong influencer, great communicator, organized and enjoys solving real life problems to make a meaningful impact to the team. This is a multi-disciplinary role focused on strategic planning, business management, staffing readiness, executive preparedness and communication. You will regularly meet with leaders and partners in Finance, Marketing, Human Resources, Strategic Analytics, Product Teams, IT, Governance, Legal and Compliance in order to effectively drive the business forward and deliver monthly, quarterly and annual strategic priorities.Job ResponsibilitiesParticipate strategic business planning and goal establishment Maintain accurate and timely communication of near and long-term goals Create executive presentations for multiple different events and scenarios Planning, managing and executing:Monthly Business Unit Reviews (BUR)Quarterly, global town hall meetings.Bi-annual leadership team offsite meetingsManage resource planning and optimization. Enhance employee engagement and leadership training. Demonstrate the ability to maintain and constantly refine a standardized business management process for BB Risk and partner teams.Maintain timely, accurate execution of all implied tasks required of a professional business manager.Required Qualifications, Capabilities, And SkillsMinimum of 2 years of experience in management/business analyst positionsStrong project management, organizational skills and attention to detailThe ability to earn trust and influence peers, meet deadlines, respond immediately to escalated issues and quickly adjust to ever-changing priorities, with minimal guidance.Demonstrated leadership solving business problems and providing a clear, concise point of view to senior executivesExceptional influencing skills with experience in managing complex organizations, operations, and programs with diverse stakeholdersSuperior communication, team building, and presentation skillsAbility to mediate across multiple constituencies and manage multiple simultaneous objectives is imperativeSocial maturity and confidence. The inherent ability to perform under stress with elegance.Build and maintain relationships with peers inside and outside the organization, identify opportunities, develop solutions and implement modifications using strong collaboration across teamsPreferred Qualifications, Capabilities, And SkillsPrior leadership and management experience, including experience turning findings into executable plans, holding partners accountable and driving alignment across multiple teams toward a common goal.About UsChase is a leading financial services firm, helping nearly half of America’s households and small businesses achieve their financial goals through a broad range of financial products. Our mission is to create engaged, lifelong relationships and put our customers at the heart of everything we do. We also help small businesses, nonprofits and cities grow, delivering solutions to solve all their financial needs.We offer a competitive total rewards package including base salary determined based on the role, experience, skill set, and location. For those in eligible roles, discretionary incentive compensation which may be awarded in recognition of individual achievements and contributions. We also offer a range of benefits and programs to meet employee needs, based on eligibility. These benefits include comprehensive health care coverage, on-site health and wellness centers, a retirement savings plan, backup childcare, tuition reimbursement, mental health support, financial coaching and more. Additional details about total compensation and benefits will be provided during the hiring process.We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. We also make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs. Visit our FAQs for more information about requesting an accommodation.Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/VeteransAbout The TeamOur Consumer & Community Banking division serves our Chase customers through a range of financial services, including personal banking, credit cards, mortgages, auto financing, investment advice, small business loans and payment processing. We’re proud to lead the U.S. in credit card sales and deposit growth and have the most-used digital solutions – all while ranking first in customer satisfaction.Risk Management helps the firm understand, manage and anticipate risks in a constantly changing environment. The work covers areas such as evaluating country-specific risk, understanding regulatory changes and determining credit worthiness. Risk Management provides independent oversight and maintains an effective control environment.

title: Techno Functional Consultant
job_description: About Wipro:Wipro Limited (NYSE: WIT, BSE: 507685, NSE: WIPRO) is a leading technology services and consulting company focused on building innovative solutions that address clients’ most complex digital transformation needs. We leverage our holistic portfolio of capabilities in consulting, design, engineering, operations, and emerging technologies to help clients realize their boldest ambitions and build future-ready, sustainable businesses. A company recognized globally for its comprehensive portfolio of services, strong commitment to sustainability and good corporate citizenship, we have over 250,000 dedicated employees serving clients across 66 countries. We deliver on the promise of helping our customers, colleagues, and communities thrive in an ever-changing world.A PROUD HISTORY OF OVER 75 YEARSFY22 REVENUE 10.4 BN USDWE’RE PRESENT IN 66 COUNTRIESOVER 1,400 ACTIVE GLOBAL CLIENTSRole: Facets EngineerLocation: Nashville, TNRole Description:Note: Healthcare domain experience is Must.Job Description:Business Acceptance or User Acceptance Testing (BAT/UAT) Analyst/Tester supporting fulfillment enrolment and agent experience. This person will coordinate with Fulfillment Business SME to understand all aspects of business needs and works with Fulfillment QA/QE team on the capability test plans, scope for releases and provide frequent feedback, including recommendations for improvements, evaluation of problems and potential solutions.Responsibilities: Work with Fulfillment Test data and Test environment teams on all technical aspects of deployment for UAT environment readiness for testing Gain a deep working knowledge of Medicare business, IT landscape, and coordinate collaboration of the UAT team Drive automation first approach for all UAT testing in collaboration with UAT Automation Engineers Review and Contribute to the development and maintenance of a library of test cases that are designed to ensure that software, data, content and configurations meets businessrequirements. Lead UAT Defect triage meeting Develop and execute test scripts, test conditions, input test data, and expected results for User Acceptance Testing Prepare Production checkout plan, data and scenarios working with business SME and end users Identify and document defects, issues, risks and dependencies Work with product owners to define acceptance criteria Coordinate with Product Owner, Technical Leads, Product Managers and QA on readiness for release and timeline Measure and report test coverage across all applicable coverage dimensions Ensure appropriate testing tasks are scheduled during release, iteration planning Actively collaborate with developers and business stakeholders to clarify requirements, especially in terms of testability, consistency, and completeness Participate proactively in daily standup meetings, story grooming sessions, team retrospectives and suggest improvements Coordinate production checkouts and engage end users and training team for production checkouts. Deliver internal UAT results to ensure high quality before releasing a solution and collaborate with end user for exploratory UAT cycles Establish standard processes for managing end user feedback, triaging issues and routing to and from product and engineering. Provide recommendations for Go/ No Go release decisions based on sound UAT testing inclusiveof functional and regression testing.Requirements Include: 5+ years of experience working with TriZetto Facets Application especially expertise knowledge on Enrollment, Providers, Claims and UM modules. Thorough understanding of Facets claims adjudication process and pricing logic, troubleshoot, identify root cause, and resolve claims processed in the Facets UI. 5+ yrs. of experience and deep understanding of the TriZetto FACETS Data model across all modules. Expert in developing and executing test scripts related to HIPAA Gateway, X12 EDI Transactions such as 837 I/P, 277CA, 834, 835, TA1, 999, 820 Strong testing hands-on experience in performing Functional, Regression, UAT,BAT testing. Good hands-on SQL skills to perform database level validations. Strong Agile working experience using JIRA.Wipro is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and makes all employment and employment-related decisions without regard to a person's race, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability, sexual orientation, or any other status protected by applicable law.HC - Payor

title: Senior Analyst Materials Planning
job_description: Eaton’s IS AER FMC division is currently seeking a Senior Analyst Materials Planning. The Euclid facility has approximately 300 employees and is a leader in the design, development, manufacture and delivery of aerospace main engine fuel pumps and components, systems and services to the global aftermarket and OEM markets.The expected annual salary range for this role is $77249.97 - $117700.04 a year. This position is also eligible for a variable incentive program. Please note the salary information shown above is a general guideline only. Salaries are based upon candidate skills, experience, and qualifications, as well as market and business considerations.What You’ll DoThe Senior Planner is responsible for managing customer web portals, retrieving forecast information from customer portals, planning and scheduling in order to balance the forecast with actual demand, maintaining optimal inventory levels. Also, responsible for customer service activities associated with the delivery of specific customer products. Expected to utilize various business systems, a variety of reports and other analytical tools to ensure timely and economical completion of customer requirements.In This Function, You WillProvide High Performance Work Teams with transparency to longer term plan, material availability, and work center loading through monthly roundtable reviews. Evaluate material needed for calls sent from MRO throughout day.Monitor inventory transactions to assure material is being processed in an accurate and timely manner. Identify and communicate potential delays and/or problems to internal and external customers which may impede customer delivery.Maximize material availability by proactively identifying future work order material requirements, or material call requirements, and facilitating delivery with the appropriate teams. Review open material orders (calls, DO's, SO's) for potential fulfillments & adjust due dates as needed in Edge. Attend MRO Tier 2 meeting. Identify critical shortages & relay projected delivery dates. Update delivery section of the MRO tier board.Manage all due dates (calls fulfilled current day as well as calls with shortages based on MPS feedback w/ stock dates). Manage expense part bags to replenish 2 bin system (Kanban System).Evaluate and recommend changes to planning parameters like lot size, lead time, and safety stock levels. Allocate parts to calls with no shortages and send to stock crib.Analyze data, including enterprise requirements planning information (work order, work center, inventory, forecast) and prepare consolidated managerial reports as needed to facilitate and recommend actions to improve plant/product line supply chain execution.Leads and participates on manufacturing cell improvement teams, driving the continuous improvement of operations by setting/communicating goals, team building, and analysis.QualificationsBasic (Required) Qualifications:Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited institution.A minimum of three (3) years of experience in a manufacturing environment.This position requires use of information or access to hardware which is subject to the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR). All applicants must be U.S. persons within the meaning of ITAR. ITAR defines a U.S. person as a U.S. Citizen, U.S. Permanent Resident (i.e., 'Green Card Holder'), Political Asylee, or Refugee.Must be authorized to work in the United States without company sponsorship now or in the future.No relocation is offered for this position. Only candidates who reside within a 50-mile radius of the Euclid, OH facility will be considered.Preferred QualificationsBachelor’s degree in Supply Chain Management.Knowledge of Materials Requirements Planning and ERP systems/MFGPro.Strong computer and data analysis skills (i.e., Excel, Access, database management).Responsible for work assignments with increasing difficulty requiring increase scope and knowledge.Thorough understanding of Supply Chain Management operational concepts surrounding production. Planning, inventory control, purchasing, logistics, stockroom operations, and shipping/receiving.Customer Service/UI ExperienceWe are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all job applicants and employees. Employment decisions are based upon job-related reasons regardless of an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, marital status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by law.Eaton considers qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with local laws. To request a disability-related reasonable accommodation to assist you in your job search, application or interview process, please call us at 1-800-836-6345 to discuss your specific need. Only accommodation requests will be accepted by this phone number.We know that good benefit programs are important to employees and their families. Eaton provides various Health and Welfare benefits as well as Retirement benefits, and several programs that provide for paid and unpaid time away from work. Click here for more detail: Eaton Benefits Overview. Please note that specific programs and options available to an employee may depend on eligibility factors such as geographic location, date of hire, and the applicability of collective bargaining agreements.]]>

title: Senior Electronic Data Interchange Analyst
job_description: Job Description:Role: Senior EDI AnalystLocation: Hudson, Ohio (hybrid)Job Type: Full-Time Position and Role:We are looking for a candidate that is highly organized, good at troubleshooting, forward thinking, has good communication skills and is self-motivated. Coordinate communications between ERP and EDI systems.Review EDI errors/failures and take corrective action to ensure compliance with required methods and procedures.Full understanding of all EDI aspects (Forms, data conversions, transports).Full understanding of VANs.Must be able to learn quickly and adapt to new trading partners.Must be able to work additional hours as needed to meet deadlines and demonstrate an ability to work under pressure.Teamwork is a critical skills this position is highly interactive with colleagues and other business contacts and all levels; interpersonalskills will be evaluated.Must demonstrate exceptional time managementMust demonstrate ability to research and resolve problems using a variety of resources and tools.Provide updates on status and completion to Director of Oracle Technologies and affected user(s) via voicemail and E-Mail. Education and Experience:Experience writing and executing queries in Microsoft SQL Server Management StudioMust have high technical aptitudeHave worked on assignments that are complex in nature in which judgment, critical thinking and initiative are required to accomplish the objectives of the assignmentHave successfully completed work tasks with minimal oversightHave successfully managed and prioritized multiple tasksAbility to work under pressure and meet deadlinesMust have excellent communication and presentation skills to effectively interface with the Operations staff, and external representatives from the payer and provider communities.

title: Payroll and HRIS Analyst
job_description: Human ResourcesMiamisburg, OHID: 314-382Full-Time/RegularWhat if you could go to work and contribute to a sustainable future? Billerud is a leading sustainable packaging materials and paper company. We are passionate paper makers committed to providing the best solutions to our customers. It is our goal to deliver a quality product, on time. We offer competitive compensation, full benefits, opportunities for growth and advancement, and an understanding that our people make us successful. If you are passionate about what you do and driven to do it well, there is a place for you at Billerud!Our HR team focuses not only on compliance and risk management but also takes a holistic approach to people operations. Our priority is to maximize employee value by aligning with the overall business strategy. We actively participate in strategic conversations to ensure that people-related decisions are well-informed and contribute to the organizational goals.Currently, we are looking for a detail-oriented and experienced HRIS and Payroll Analyst to join our team!Summary Description:The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing and optimizing our payroll system and ensuring accuracy, consistency, and efficiency in our payroll processes. In addition to the timely processing of bi-weekly payrolls, the successful candidate will also oversee payroll tax, compliance, and reconciliation. This position will also serve to direct, guide, and support field HR and Payroll resources with respect to the payroll system and associated processes.Key Accountabilities:Manage and administer the payroll module within Dayforce HCM system, including configuration, maintenance, and troubleshooting. Implement and test system changes, upgrades, and new features related to payroll processing.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement payroll tax changes and updates including but not limited to state and local business registration.Administer and process bi-weekly payrolls.Maintain payroll process workflows and documentation. Provide guidance, process and technical support, as well as training, to field personnel and end-users of system functionality and best practices related to payroll processing. Ensure data integrity and accuracy in payroll system through regular quarterly and annual audits and validations.Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements, analyze business processes, and recommend system or process enhancements related to payroll processing.Collaborate with external vendors and tax advisors related to Ex-Patriot payroll calculations and associated international tax compliance.Stay abreast of payroll tax laws, regulations, and reporting requirements; ensure compliance.Conduct research on payroll and tax related issues and provide guidance to internal stakeholders.Ensure appropriate reconciliation to payroll tax accounts is being managed and discrepancies are resolved in a timely manner. This involves work with both internal finance resources as well as external vendor resources.Submit and manage ticketing process for payroll tax notices and inquiries.Manage special projects and initiatives related to payroll tax and compliance.Other HRIS and Payroll duties as assigned.Required SkillsMinimum Required Skills: Understanding of payroll regulations, tax laws, and compliance requirements at local, state, and federal levels. Ability to interpret tax laws and/or work with internal or external counsel or other tax resources as appropriate. Proficiency with payroll systems and system administration. Comfort with assessing and reacting to payroll tax and compliance regulatory changes. Ability to troubleshoot system issues and perform system configurations and upgrades. Ability to document processes, procedures, and system changes effectively.Preferred Skills: Prior experience with international payrolls is a plus. Payroll experience in Ohio, Pennsylvania, or other state with large number of local taxes.Required ExperienceMinimum Required Experience and Education: BS/BA in related field of study. 7+ years of experience in payroll system administration and processing.Preferred Experience & Education 7+ years of experience in payroll system administration and processing. Certified Payroll Professional (CPP) Dayforce (formerly known as Ceridian Dayforce) experience is a plus.

title: Compensation Analyst
job_description: Job Title  : Compensation Analyst Department  : Human Resources Reports  to: Director of Compensation, Benefits, and HRISAt Redwood Living Inc. (“Redwood”), we know we are only as successful as the people who power us. Our employees are passionate, they are talented, they are empowered to make decisions that positively affect the lives of our residents. From site personnel to corporate leadership, our employees demonstrate Redwood's commitment to deliver more than expected, communicate openly and honestly, and demonstrate integrity in all aspects of our business. As we continue to grow, we seek these same qualities in every team member we bring on board.Position OverviewUnder the general direction of the Director of Compensation, Benefits, and HRIS, the Compensation Analyst will be responsible for administering the foundational components of compensation and assist in the strategic design and analysis to support a proactive compensation philosophy at Redwood. Furthermore, this role will be responsible for researching job requirements and evaluating job positions to ensure the company is competitive in the areas of salaries and employee benefits. As such, this role will be expected to act as a Redwood brand ambassador, promote the Redwood brand and provide the best employee and resident experience possible.All Redwood employees are expected to conduct all organizational business and practices in accordance to Redwood company policies.Essential Duties & Responsibilities Serve as compensation subject matter expert and liaison to all levels of leadership within the organization.  Set internal compensation practices and company pay guidelines, specifically, the evaluation of internal company pay bands, grades, and levels. Ensure cost of living adjustments and inflation are represented and evaluated as external factors influence.  Utilize benchmarking and prevalence reports to evaluate external competitiveness and fair pay practices.  General compensation practices that fall under the scope of duties include long term incentives (LTI) compensation planning, short term incentives (STI) compensation planning, ownership equity, compensation plan design, compensation theory, and pay benchmarking.  Gathers data from market-based compensation surveys; uses spreadsheet and data analysis techniques to assess results and market trends.  Apply market-based data to annual internal review of Redwood existing jobs to assess outliers, wage compression, rightsizing, pay adjustments, or the alike.  Evaluates and implements job analysis tools, instruments, and materials.  Research employee benefits in similar industries; based on findings, recommends changes or updates to the company’s existing benefits or compensation policies.  Plans and communicates preferred methods and best practices for hiring, training, compensating, and evaluating employees.  Works with Director on annual total rewards pay statement in HRIS system.  Active member of the compensation committee. This includes working directly with Redwood’s external compensation consultant to consult and align on all responsibilities rolling up through the compensation HR function.  Align with Business Intelligence team on internal HR dashboards specifically related to compensation and benefits KPIs.  Evaluates job descriptions for each position in the organization; ensures descriptions accurately reflect the work being performed by employees.  Interviews and surveys employees and managers to gather and document job, organizational, and occupational information including duties, responsibilities, and skills required by each job.  Assesses jobs and their respective duties to determine classification as exempt or nonexempt and appropriate salary range.  Benchmarks jobs against survey data and other market intelligence to determine competitive compensation ranges for each position.  Prepares and maintains job classifications and salary scales; review updates in HRIS.  Prepares and presents summary reports of job analysis and compensation analysis information.  Advises management on applicable state and federal employment regulations, benefits and compensation policies, and human resource procedures.  Support director in activities related to administration of annual merit increase and annual bonus processes. This includes direct partnership with department heads and leadership team to set, recommend, calibrate, and approve annual merit increases/bonuses per year end timeline.  Work with Director to establish and incorporate the existing internal company annual performance review (APR) process and programming into a Pay for Performance (PFP) compensation design model.  Create Redwood Compensation Guidelines policy manual and supervisor guide under guidance of the Director.  Performs other related duties as assigned. Required SkillsAs a Compensation Analyst, you will be required to exhibit the following skills: Extensive knowledge of quantitative and qualitative research methods.  Extensive knowledge of human resource laws, regulations, and best practices.  Strong time management skills and general business acumen.  The ability to communicate and interact with employees at all organizational levels.  Proven ability to plan, organize and implement multiple tasks/projects on a concurrent, real-time basis.  High attention to detail and organization skills required.  Ability to maintain confidentiality to ensure integrity in pay practices.  Maintain a teamwork mentality in order to achieve departmental goals. Required Qualifications, Education & Certifications Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources or related field required.  SHRM-CP or SHRM-SCP preferred.  Three to five years of experience as a compensation analyst required.  General computer proficiency and experience in Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel, or similar software.  Working Conditions This job operates in a professional office environment. In this role, the employee will routinely use standard office equipment such as computers, desk phones, iPhone, photocopiers, etc. The employee is frequently required to sit, stand, bend and walk with the ability to lift 20 pounds where applicable.The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by individuals assigned this job title. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all required responsibilities, duties and skills, and such responsibilities, duties and skills may be changed by Redwood at any time.

title: Corporate Responsibility Analyst
job_description: Location:127 Public Square - Cleveland, Ohio 44114Location:Hybrid - In Office 1 to 2 times a week; 127 Public Square, Cleveland, OH.About the Job:At KeyBank, Corporate Responsibility is an enterprise-wide function that collaborates with all lines of business to strengthen our brand and reputation by fulfilling our purpose of assisting our clients, colleagues, and communities to thrive. KeyBank’s priorities are Financial Inclusion, Diversity, Equity and Inclusion, Climate Stewardship, Data Privacy, and Security. These priorities are both an opportunity and an obligation in our culture driven by values and purpose. The Community Relations and Corporate Initiatives team is responsible for creating and implementing a community engagement strategy throughout the enterprise and ensuring that teammates are engaged in volunteerism and financial empowerment programming.Community Relations and Corporate Initiatives seeks a talented and motivated Corporate Responsibility (CR) Analyst to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate for this role will be accountable for examining CR (Corporate Responsibility) data to extract important insights, trends, and opportunities that will help in making business decisions, encouraging sustainable practices, and effectively narrating KeyBank's CR story. The CR Analyst will assist in the programmatic delivery of KeyBank's financial empowerment program. Additionally, the candidate will assist with creating speaking points and presentations for stakeholder engagement.Essential Job Functions:Analytical FunctionsResearch and analyze corporate responsibility trends, best practices, and regulations to inform strategy development.Monitor and evaluate the impact of community engagement initiatives, collecting feedback and data for continuous improvement.Manage and report on key performance indicators related to CR goals and objectives.Collect, analyze, and report on community investments, community engagement, financial empowerment activities to support KeyBank's community impact and regulatory reporting.Support community engagement initiatives, including volunteer programs, local and national partnerships.Prepare reports, presentations, and communication materials to highlight KeyBank’s corporate responsibility initiatives and outcomes.Collect CR impact stories in partnership with marketing and communications.Manage intake process for financial empowerment workshop requests, identify, and manage gaps in delivery across Key’s footprint. Provide technical assistance for volunteer tracking and stakeholder engagement platforms.Help to design and develop civic engagement playbooks and orientation for new Key teammates.Community Engagement & Volunteer Programmatic FunctionsAssist with the planning, coordination, and execution of community events, including but not limited to financial empowerment workshops, volunteer activities, and corporate sponsorships.Assist with the scheduling and logistics of market-level community listening sessions, ensuring smooth execution, documentation of community needs, and timely follow-up.Collaborate with Corporate Responsibility Officers and retail leadership to develop regional Financial Empowerment Councils to engage with local communities.Work with National Community Engagement Strategist to implement tactics focused on establishing and maintaining relationships with clients, community partners, nonprofits, and local stakeholders.Stay informed about market level community needs, trends, and opportunities to make recommendations for engagement and line of business strategies.Work with the Senior Manager, Financial Education and Volunteer Programs to increase awareness of KeyBank’s financial empowerment program with communities, schools and districts, small businesses, and approved nonprofit, civic and community-based organizations, while helping develop a framework for regular deployment within Key’s footprint.Required Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in finance, business, sustainability, social responsibility, or a related field.Project management skills to ensure timely and accurate CR reporting deliverables.Proficiency in data collection, analysis, and interpretation, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint for data analysis and presentation development.Experience in developing community engagement programs and financial empowerment initiatives.Ability to develop knowledge of Community Reinvestment Act, and community development services requirements.Excellent written and verbal communication skillsAbility to work collaboratively in a team environment and build relationships with internal and external partners.Demonstrated ability to organize and prioritize tasks effectively.Self-motivated and able to work independently with minimal supervision.Compensation And BenefitsThis position is eligible to earn a base salary in the range of $60,000 to $85,000 annually depending on location and job-related factors such as level of experience. Compensation for this role also includes eligibility for short-term incentive compensation and deferred incentive compensation subject to individual and company performance.Please click here for a list of benefits for which this position is eligible.Job Posting Expiration Date: 05/31/2024KeyCorp is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer committed to building a diverse, equitable and inclusive culture. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or other protected category.Qualified individuals with disabilities or disabled veterans who are unable or limited in their ability to apply on this site may request reasonable accommodations by emailing HR_Compliance@keybank.com.
